title: "I won't miss" -- Ashe returns to pro play

replies.body: I personally think the new {{champion:22}} kicks some {{champion:22}} . Sorry but I just don`t think there is {{champion:1}} other adc better than her. Update: (I just wanted to get top comment so I made a pun, but apparently it sparked something within you guys, I dont even play adc) You guys are just too {{champion:91}} ted

ehm..what? Jinx has arguably an even mid-game and a way better late and teamfighting potential. Kog'maw is the god of hypercarries and has armor shred. Lucian is good in pretty much all stages of the game and has a dash. Tristana has incredible range and is strong in all stages of the game. Not to mention she can rocketjump and has an AOE knockback. Graves is better in teamfights with his aoe burst and has a dash. 

Tl;dr there is no 'best' adc as you might claim/imply every champ fits a comp, every champ has a purpose and has abilities that makes him unique or different compared to other adc's. Ashe is nothing different at all. I dare say that Kalista is arguably even or even better then ashe at some things in the game. Kalista has a sentinel. Extremely strong early game. Can create picks and has an ult that is an AOE knockup and with hurricaan cajn aoe slow and has unlimited kiting potential and basically a second smite. U wot m9? No adc better? Really? All adc's are good in what they're supposed to be good at. Nothing more and nothing less.

Bruh, you clearly missed the point of tl;dr..

tl;dr Ashe too stronk
Lol cracked me up... The tl;dr was actually longer than the original paragraph.
dead had me weak.
Ashe is all you need to {{champion:86}} tee {{champion:112}} {{champion:11}}

Riot Logic:
Buffs Ashe really hard, then makes article about Ashe returning into pro play
The same with assassins, they nerfed the shit out of all assassins then wrote an article titled "The fall of assassins in pro play.."

{{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:238}} we rule this rift.
Riot: _hmmm they do seem to, lets nerf them._
{{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} what the heck why are we so week now?
Riot: it is just the **natural** way the game flows.
{{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} Hey Zed why are you not with us?
{{champion:238}} Sorry guys but...... Riot loves me. :D
{{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} What a load of crap
Riot: Hmmm they don't seem to be useless enough what can we do...... oh ...... of cores buff the tanks. :D
{{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} What the crap we do no damage and now the tanks destroy us what is up with this?
Riot: it is just the **natural** way the game flows.
Riot: _o crap these tanks are sweet but we don't want people to think we have favorites._
Riot: Akali, Fizz your cries have not fallen upon could hearts...... we will watch the tanks to see how bad it is.
_Riot privately high fives themselves on their cleverness. _
{{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} oh so if it was not bad enough to be suffering right now they have to watch us on top of it too.
some time passes
Riot: yes we see the problem, but we don't want to over react to this problem sooooo lets tweak thing a bit.
{{champion:105}} so let me get this strait Riot is "tweaking" them inorder to give the tanks more time in the lime light. Well enjoy it while it lasts tanks because after this year "the year of the tanks" Riot will say, " Tanks your time is up 'it is just the **natural** way the game flows.'"
{{champion:84}} "Will matchmaking ever find true balance?"

First, true balance in a game is overrated. It's boring. If I wanted perfect balance I'd go play Rock, Paper, Scissors. 

Second, who cares if riot is pushing one strategy over another? Of course they are doing this because they want their game to continue to grow and remain interesting. If they left everything the way it was, the game would stagnate and die. You're absolutely right, tanks are going to fall out of favor soon enough, and we'll have a new meta dominated by a new strategy. But purposely causing change and shifting the balance of power is how game developers keep their product fun. It's not a bad thing. It's how you encourage long term growth and interest in a healthy game.

So is what happened to assassins completely natural? No. But what is natural is that a game either has to evolve, or die. Riot is simply trying to evolve their game.

Hey, sorry guys this was purely a joke. I am well aware of the fact that tanks counter assassins and i was meaning that to be part of the joke, but i may have leaned a bit to much on riot as the antagonist for this to be funny and i am sorry for that. i actually love the game a lot thus the post, and i don't mind the meta shifts at all. I can see that my humor must be refined a bit more before my next post, but thank you all a bunch for the feed back because i now can see how my post can be seen negatively and i am sorry for that. I don't like the negative side of the community and do not want to add to it so thanks for all the comments.

P.S sorry for the grammar i never red my stuff over much witch also lead into me missing the humor side a bit. Also i love Riot and have had no real complaints with them. :D

The job of a tank is to protect the weak carries. How can a tank do that if he gets insta killed by an assassin. Also Tanks needs their damage to be relevant otherwise carries could just ignore them and focus on enemy carries. This is why tanks destroy assassin, because they are a combination of tanky and damage. The tank meta makes it so the fate of the game isnt entirely decided by wich assassin will be best but rather wich team has the best teamwork and team comp. At least that's what I think

Assassins aren't supposed to be tank killers.  They're supposed to be ADC/Mage nightmares.  Tanks counter assassins by being able to take the burst damage and hold them off until someone can kill them.  It's the assassin's fault for trying to kill a tank and not zeroing in on the enemy ADC/Mage.  Let your team's ADC and Bruisers take care of the enemy tank after everyone else is dead...
I mean, to be fair, assassins still eat up squishy champs. Poor {{champion:268}}  T,,T
The grammar alone was so cringe-worthy it's impossible to even find humor in your opinion.

All while planning on nerfing her after raking in dough from the people who do well on buffed up Ashe and buy skins for their new pro level champ (Doublelift Seal of Approval included on the packaging amirite).
I really doubt they plan on nerfing ashe. She was reworked.... the term work is there for a reason- these guys crunch the numbers and know what they are doing.

Much like how they didn't need to adjust Lucian post-rework.
Or Casiopeia.
Or Ryze.
Or Zilean.
Or- you see what I'm getting at yet?
Maoki Sion? ring any bells

Okay, but you're also forgetting to factor in the fact that both Maokai and Sion are tanks (which in the new meta makes them just that much better alone) as well as have amazing kits. Don't get me wrong, I was upset when I saw the nerfs to Maokai, and my brother loves Sion (Even thought the juggernaut is still fantastic at what he does). They weren't given a rework and then instantly nerfed. They were left to sit until the meta made it to where a good Sion would dominate any game, and a good Maokai would set up so much bullying in lane that it was near impossible to stay. 
Tl;dr: It wasn't the rework that got these two amazing champions nerfed. It was simply the meta and their play style. Riot likes to see everything played and wanted something other than Sion every match.

The departments are separate. They don't really factor that into their decision -- if they did they'd go for a higher priced Champion by far. The simple fact is that they over buffed Ashe in the reworking and will 100% nerf her in the near future. She just brings everything to the table at the moment.

Sadly yes, most likely her e will get a range reduction or will only reveal the target area instead of the travel path too, Im ok with that though, nerfing her high uility while leaving her enough to make it relevant to her team is fine, I just really hope they dont destroy her damage output for the sake of retaining her utility, she's an adc, not a support damn it.

That is because Riot is huge and all the departments are highly disconnected now. The teams that do balance and the teams that do eSports news coverage are completely different (often in completely different cities). That is a big problem with Riot at the moment and why they proceed with everything so slowly... there's no department that connects all the pieces together as a coherent whole.

Wait a god damn minute. You know why China and Korea do so much better? It's cause they play more. In the lcs, teams play 2 overhyped matches a week for a total of 18 best of ones. In china, edg plays 40 games a split. All in series. No wonder na and eu with some exceptions gets rocked, China and Korea just have way more competitive  experience. Either we make the lcs like that or we keep on with the pretty presentation of a crappy product. We can't expect players to be conformable in competative situations coming from the lcs.

One of the biggest problems for NA is money, china and korea have huge potential for e-sports while here in NA we still have huge parts of the population trying to argue with the government that League isn't a sport and can't be considered competitive (albeit these people tend to ignore the facts provided to them) because of this NA e-sports aren't provided the sponsorship and funding that could support more games in a week. Now i know what your thinking RIOT is making loads off of league they don't need the extra sponsorship. It's not them that needs the funding its the players. pro players don't make much from tournaments or playing during the season. Really it just provides them with a face to promote their stream where they make most of their money. If the countries we lived in was working towards advancement and understanding (not just on a sports level for league of legends but in science math and other subjects) instead of quite often belittling degrading and even arguing against these subjects.

74% of Americans believe in god with the only proof being a book about a person that we have no proof did not have schizophrenia

50~% of Americans also believe that vaccine's cause autism.

And people still think America is the best country in the world...

I liked your point before you implied my stupidity because of my nation of origin.

The comments about god and vaccinations did absolutely nothing to further your point and seemed to be solely placed there to be inflammatory.(Well done)

Cite your outdated and misrepresentative sources please.
China also only has one phenomenal team, a few decent ones and a lot of teams who just muck around because they have so many games that they don't care.
40 matches a split is a lot. but 18 is too less.

Ashe is much much MUCH better due to the rework, I can definitely see her coming back to the lcs, on a huge note... **FIX YOUR SERVER RIOT**

Also... dat Ashe ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
Lol Doublelift has a point in Frenzy on his masteries when he can't crit..?

? Ashe crits every time she hits a slowed enemy. Every four shots is max frenzy.

It's a really good early-game steroid.

{{champion:22}}  cannot crit NORMALLY, is what her new passive states. She still crits, it's just no longer an X% chance to happen for 200% damage. This new sort of crit also applies to {{item:3087}} {{item:3122}} {{item:3185}} which is hilarious to think about, I love {{item:3185}} {{champion:22}}  in 3's, constantly applying a slow and gaining vision on them. Thou shall not kite! also fun fact, {{item:3185}}  and {{item:3122}}  have a unique passive that applies a bleed, however they're not the same exact effect and they are not named, so these items actually stack for a 150% bonus AD ratio bleed on crits.
The queen of the Frejord has returned! All hail Queen {{champion:22}} !
{{champion:127}}  Lissandra is the _**Queen**_
I guess i can try attack speed {{champion:22}} It seams okay but two {{item:3172}} can be hard to get...
Riot  just get the new zac skin and the game will be a pool party
Didn't like the old Ashe..... still don't like the new Ashe

The new Ashe is the perfect example of how Riot doesn't understand balance. Now her passive makes her AA slow without the drain of mana and replaces that ability with an AS boost that still slows you. Volly now shoots more so guess what most def going to hit you. Her ult now has an AOE that guess what also slows nearby enemies... So now you have an ultimate CC champ with amazing range. Please Riot just try to learn how the game that you make works because you keep just breaking Champs and leaving under powered champs in the dust because they're not popular.

Have you even played the champ yet? She by no means is op. Yes, she is much stronger than the old Ashe but the old Ashe didn't have much base dmg to begin with. Her volley shoots more but it is easier to block now, so minions become a shield to use now against her volley. Her AA slow is there to compensate for her lack of any mobility. Other adc's like Vayne, Ezreal and Tristana have a lot of mobility and cc. Ashe makes up for the lack of mobility with harder cc. If this is the definition of broken then over 80% of all champions need to be redone.

Yes, her passive makes her AA slow, but she can only fire so fast, and cannot target anyone in brush she hasn't checked yet. Hawkshot will only reveal for so long. Please keep in mind that new Volley's arrows can hit the same target more than once, but deal no extra damage or slow, while old Volley's arrows would actually hit you more than once, dealing more damage and making it more viable for shotgunning. As we've already explored with the latest addition to our roster (Ekko is so kawaii), Ashe isn't the most powerful for damage. Instead, she relies on a power window for a large portion of her damage, and her CC to attempt to force a fight with said power window. Her shared weakness with all ADCs is her susceptibility to dying while under the effects of crowd control. As soon as she gets stunned or snared, she's practically ~~Garenteed~~ guaranteed to go down in a teamfight. Silences also remove a large portion of her damage potential for a short while, given that ranger's focus wasn't activated beforehand. Concerning her ult, it isn't quite the easiest thing to dodge and it can often come in unexpectedly during team fights. The downside to it is shared with Super Mega Death Rocket (and to a lesser extent, Trueshot Barrage) with it being quite difficult to aim, given that it loses effectiveness when shotgunned. If your team is spread out or taking jungle routes, Ashe will often have difficulty hitting her target.
Ashe's old volley could not hit a target multiple times the rest would go through so you could volley a champ through a minion wave but could never apply increased damage.
AHEM- Kappa
If people would just learn to play {{champion:45}} they would understand that nothing is hard to kill
I always went legendary with her before her re-work. Now I'm just not interested in playing her.
Hawkshot needs a nerf to be in line with everything else imho. May as well allow TF to warp across the map at will and a few other things that were nerfed from being global to something less so.

This was the old Ashe, but the queen has had her coronation and she’s raining furious frost arrows down on the Rift.
